title: How was Mexican music influence by German settlers? - Quora

response.answer_text: A lot in the north of Mexico, the current "Música Norteña" (northern music) is a music genre that exists thanks of the German and Scandinavian  settlers that came to the north of Mexico.When Maximilian I became emperor of Mexico in the Second Mexican Empire, he opened the doors to a lot of europeans immigrants to Mexico, most of them settled in the north of Mexico, in the border with the US.Those settlers were rural people who came with their instruments and started playing them in their new country. El Acordeón: Raíces y Rutas de un Instrumento Musical en América Also when Maximilian I arrived to Mexico he brought his own musical band to entertain him in his palace, once he was defeated this musicians fled to the north of Mexico with their instruments.With the pass of time these instruments broke and were fixed with local tools and material, so they started to change.The instruments brought by the settlers and musicians were the Accordion and some strings instruments like the  double bass.At the end of the XIX century these new instruments made a new music genre known nowadays as "Música Norteña"or Norteño. This music is played particularly in the north of Mexico and in the South of the US.Is characterized by the accordion in them (brought by the germans), a string instrument called "Bajo Sexto" (sixth bass), a Double Bass and sometimes Sax, Tuba or drums.This genre is a mix between polka, waltz, schottische, bolero, corrido and ranchera music.The "Música Norteña" is one of the most popular Mexican genres in the Americas.Norteño (music)
